entry.title: Need For Air, over and out. Say hello to the tldr.io blog!
entry.content:
We are still alive!

You may have noticed, we have been pretty silent lately. Our last blogpost dates back to November 14th when we announced the first release of our Chrome extension. As you can imagine, we were pretty busy working on tldr.io and didn't have enough time to maintain this blog. Lots of crazy stuff happened: we won Seedcamp Paris, we built a lot of new features including a brand new Chrome extension with which you can read or contribute the summary of any web page and our community is growing faster than ever.




What's next?

We have decided to start blogging again, but as tldr.io and not NeedForAir anymore. We'll use this new blog to keep you updated about tldr.io feature releases, best content and we'll also blog about engineering and entrepreneurial challenges.

Go read the tldr.io blog

We won't kill NeedForAir though

There are still a lot of people coming to this blog (mainly from search) for the tutorials we posted, so we won't shut it down. If you liked what you found here, be sure to check the tldr.io blog out and update your RSS subscription! And to wrap NeedForAir up, here are the five most-read articles:

  • Introduction to D3: Build an Animated Graph in 19 Lines of Code
  • Tutorial: Domain Name System for Beginners
  • How We Use Jenkins for Continuous Deployment (a bit outdated since we don't use Jenkins anymore, we coded our own CI)
  • The Game of Go: A Programmer's Perspective
  • What to Use Upstart (and Other Supervisors) For

Thank you for reading us thus far!
